name: White's City Cavern Inn

reviews.text: We wanted to see Carlsbad Caverns so decided to stay at this hotel which is only 7 mi from the Caverns. Unfortunately there is no other reason to stay here, and in fact we regretted being suckered into the convenience argument. This is a dump and they charged us $79. For that price I have had better motel experiences. It really should have cost $55. The room was very old and damp and had little flies in it. Everything seemed so old. Because it was so deserted, it felt unsafe, too. The hotel is like no other Best Western I have ever seen - it is worse. It consists of a few strips of single-story buidlings - like a motor inn. The hotel complex is deserted and looks like a movie set for a Wes Craven "The Hills Have Eyes" type movie. The "water park" is much advertised but was closed and ruinous looking - your kids would have a better time in any McDonald's playhouse. The complimentary breakfast was ok, but the restaurant looked like it had not been renovated since 1950. It was old, but not quaint. The staff are very nice and I feel sorry that they have to work at this desolate spot. Don't go there. Book something in Carlsbad the city itself, then drive the extra few miles to the Cavern.
reviews.title: Desolate, Depressing Hotel from the 1950's
Bait and Switch Tactic Used
reviews.text: You think you made a reservation at the Best Western Cavern Inn, then they switch you to one of their independently owned motels. I made my reservation on the phone, using the Automobile Club Travel Tour book. When I got to the hotel they said my reservation was with their other motel that they own. I thought bait and switch tactics were illegal. I didn't put up with this underhanded business practice and drove 20 miles to the next nearest hotel.

Our family of 5 tried to get a room at the Best Western, but they only had rooms with a single bed available, but amazingly, in the very same lobby, and counter, they had vacancies in the Walnut Inn, which is attached to the Best Western and really where the water park is. The girl who checked us in was extremely friendly, as was the Best Western girl, who had a longer line of people to help. We were able to get a room for 83 dollars that was clean and very large. It had a coffee maker, hair dryer, and ironing board with iron. One of our children slept on the inflatable sleeping bag mattress only because they wanted to, and there was plenty of room to walk around. The sheets and towels were clean, but the whirlpool tub did not work. The air conditoner in July was cold, VERY nice, as it was hot outside. When we checked in, they gave us writstbands for the water park and meal tickets for breakfast. The water park was really fun, even for we parents. Take sunscreen. Tickets to the water park if you are not staying in the motor hotels are 8 dollars a person, so being five of us, we saved 40 dollars there, and the breakfasts cost 5.50, so we saved 27.50 there, for a total of 67.50 in perks, so one can stretch it and say the room itself actually cost us under 25 dollars...can't complain too much at that price. So I didn't complain that the whirlpool tub in the room was not working, although that would have been icing on the cake. We heard no complaints at the pool or the restaurant about the rooms or food. We did not eat lunch or dinner, as we packed our own ice chest and food with us, which was good because the grocery store is really small and limited to mainly snacks. But truly most of all, more than the Inn or waterpark, Carlsbad Caverns is right there...an amazing and magnificent place to experience. The children had a GREAT time, and it was all worth the money.
reviews.title: The family enjoyed it...

reviews.text: We chose this hotel based soley on the fact that it was located so close to the Caverns, even though it was nearly $20 more than comparable motels in Carlsbad, 20 miles away. Our room was very old, but clean, and the air conditioner was only marginally working. We had it turned down all the way, and the room was merely slightly cool. At least it was quiet. The shower was great, the beds comfortable, and the water park/pool area was great, especially for my young son. While my teenager stayed in the room with the wireless internet, my son and I spent several hours at the pool. He could have slid down the tube slides all day.
reviews.title: Close to the Caverns

reviews.text: Breakfast was included, and we had 4 choices (pancakes, scrambled eggs, hot cereal, and something else). Dinner was a little pricey (not much to choose from in this small town), and just ok. I would not have eaten there a second time, and would have driven into nearby Carlsbad for dinner.
reviews.title: Dont get excitied

reviews.text: I booked this hotel because of its location and I am still glad that I did. The staff was nice and helpful, the rooms were clean and it was nice to be so close to Carlsbad Caverns. The restaurant smelt bad and the food tasted like it was just microwaved. There is a little store located across the street so you could buy food there. The gift shop was nice. The museum was eerie and kind of a joke, but a funny one. The water park was cheap but we still had lots of fun, the two water slides were good. Overall it was good and very restful.
reviews.title: great location, decent facilities
Needs a serious overhaul
reviews.text: Arrived late during the day about 4:00 pm for check in. Waited about 15 minutes for maintenance to call in order to check in. When we arrived at our room we thought it would be better to stay in cave instead. The room had an extreme moldy odor, the sink and tub drains were slow and not working properly. There was old coffee still in the coffee maker. It was obvious that the linens were not changed or any cleaning had been done. Obviously the bats can't keep up with the bugs because there plenty in our room. We slept in our sleeping bags. The only good thing going for this motel is the location it is 7 miles to the Caverns, but for a good night sleep I would recommend staying in Carlsbad 20 miles away.

reviews.title: Borderline!
reviews.text: Fairly dreary rooms. The waterpark was a joke--dirty grounds and water. Restaurants were both bad. Only upside is you are 10 minutes from the caverns. If you stay in Carlsbad, you are nearly 30 minutes from the caverns. It's up to you.

reviews.title: Great for simple overnight with kids
reviews.text: Carlsbad Caverns was the last attraction on our weeklong tour of the southwest with our 3 young children. We had stayed in various hotels along the way, all with their various problems, but sometimes you don't have a lot of options, and the best hotels are not always perfect, as other TripAdvisor reviews will tell you.

We had planned to stay in Carlsbad, but discovered the White's City hotel at the last minute. The clincher for us was the waterpark. As part of the hotel property, they have not only a pool, but a toddler pool with a showering mushroom and a pirate ship with all the usual squirting water. They also had a slide tower with 2 water slides, one enclosed and fast and one open and slower. Wristbands for the water park were included in the price of the room, as was a full breakfast. The kids loved it, especially after a long day of driving! Truthfully, so did I. Unlike waterparks near home, there were no lines. The kids could just go up and down all they wanted.
reviews.title: Don't stay at this dump

reviews.text: We reserved the Best Western online, and it seemed like a great deal. A good price in a wonderful location for visiting the park. When we arrived, however, the door to the lobby was being propped open by a flimsy chair, and the lobby was abandoned except for a young man working in street clothes. When we checked into our room, the air conditioner did not work. We then checked into another room, and it did not work either. We then asked for a room in the old wing (the "new" wing was at least 40 years old, the "old" one looks like it dates from the 1930's). In the old wing, that air conditioner did not work either, only hot air was blowing out. Finally, a nice maintenance man came by, and deduced that "they must have turned the compressor off for the winter." This being New Mexico in February, one does need cool air. The rooms are sealed, so without the air conditioner, there only blew a bit of hot air, causing the air conditioner to screech this high pitched sound. Obviously, the young man at the desk had no idea whatsoever if the air conditioners were working or not. We went back to the lobby, and said that despite reserving with the credit card, that we were not staying. We went to Carslbad and stayed at the new Comfort Inn, and had a wonderful stay in a new motel that was less expensive, and had a wonderful air conditioner!
reviews.title: Decided not to stay, upon arrival.
WORST HOTEL!!!
reviews.text: We booked a room for one queen size bed, got two. The bedding, as well as towels didn't smell clean. The so- called whirlpool tub, DID NOT work. There were constantly people talking loudly outside our room. The so-called breakfast they served, was at a restaraunt across the street, which did not look clean and people were acting funny. I believe we were overcharged for the room. I do not recommend this hotel. It is not convenient, as the stores there did not have anything we went in there to get. This is a rip-off!

There are only three hotels in Whites City and they are ALL owned/run by the same operation. So whether you stay at this BW or the other one or the White City Resort, it's all the same and it's all mediocre. The only benefit of staying at this run of the mill hotel is that you are not 10 minutes from the Carlsbad Caverns, you are right at the entrance of the Carlsbad Caverns park. Which you may think is great, but the caverns are only 20 miles outside of Carslbad which only takes about 15 minutes to get to. We stayed at the Guadalupe Inn for 1 night in December and the room was fair. Although it appeared as if the furniture was new-ish (only a few years old), the bathroom was kind of dated and dirty (I would not have taken a bath in that tub for a million dollars) and the toilet reminded me of the kind of toilet you would find in an elementary school bathroom. Our television was partially broken (some of the channels didn't get sound?). The only restaurant in Whites City is the Velvet Garter which is terrible but their breakfast is there as well and it's quick and usually included in the rate. So if you need to be RIGHT next to the caverns, stay at the Guadalupe Inn. Otherwise, find a better deal at the BW in Carlsbad or the other cheap motor lodges because it's cheaper and not in the middle of nowhere so you have more options to eat!
reviews.title: Better deals in Carlsbad!
It's better in Carlsbad!
reviews.text: We were quite disappointed in the Cavern Inn/Guadalupe Inn in White's City (they are one in the same). The room was very dirty. The AC didn't work well. We paid for a "king" size bed and got one queen. The phone in our room had to be unplugged because of an annoying noise. Jack's/Velvet Garter were dirty as well. We overheard several other guests complaining when we checked in. We recommend staying in Carlsbad. All of the restaurants are there, and the 15 minute drive to nicer accomodations is worth it!

reviews.title: Close to Carlsbad Caverns, July 5 - 7, 2004
reviews.text: It's great for convenience. It's about 10 minutes from Carlsbad Caverns. Breakfast was included in the room rate. It's not the standard continental buffet. They actually give you 4 different entree choices and it's more cafeteria style. But I would recommend driving to Carlsbad (20 minutes for dinner). The only resturant for dinner next to the motel is on the pricey side. The room was average. Sometimes the shower would go from hot to cold and then back to hot. It a good thing there are bats to eat the bugs because there's a lot of bugs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am torn here. I’ve been staying in White’s City in one of their hotels or another since my first visit to the Caverns in 1982. I believe the traveler needs to make a decision—does he or she want the convenience of staying 2/10 of a mile from the park entrance in a now clearly underwhelming, barley meeting standards hotel or put up with making possibly multiple 40 mile round trips to one of the half dozen limited service hotels in Carlsbad. I am surprised that Best Western still allows itself to be associated with this property.
reviews.title: You must make a decision!

reviews.text: The last stay began by my wife and myself being placed in a room with poor air conditioning (outside temp 96) after waiting for it to get better the front desk clerk said they were trying to get it fixed and offered me no alternative. A request to speak to the manager resulted to talking to him on the phone (he was in Carlsbad) and being moved to their non-Best Western property. A clean but substandard room. The only bright spot was the lunch we had was quite good.
reviews.title: This Place is GREAT for Kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you only need a bed, bath, and possibly A/C you will probably tolerate this hotel. But after 25 years I will stay in Carlsbad and drive the 30 minutes to the park.
reviews.title: Don't stay at this place, do the drive to & from Carlsbad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back and this place was great. The rooms were not the greatest but they were fine to sleep in. The water park was great we spent a lot of time there and had a ball. The museum was great the exhibits were a little dusty but everything was 150 years old what do you expect. The only thing that could have been better were the restaurants, there is only 1 with 2 names. So choices were limited. The caverns are just 7 miles up the hill. The next closest place to stay to the caverns is 27 miles away. The room cost me $88 dollars a night plus tax, Which includes free breakfast and admission to the water park. You cant beat that. I'm glad a lot of people give this place a bad review because they expect 5 star accomodations, just makes it easier for me to ride the water slides all day without having to wait in line.
reviews.title: We were robbed! A Nightmare!

likes.liked: — Close to Carlsbad Caverns but at a high cost.

reviews.title: worst hotel we ever stayed in
reviews.text: Best Western has bought 3 small old drive-up motels that are next to each other & called them one. Our room is gross, the carpet is stained everywhere. There is no hot water and this place is way overpriced.

aka: White`s City Cavern Hotel Whites City
description: White's City Cavern Inn is not and has not been available for tourists to reserve a room since 2010. This hotel is currently in a private partnership with another company. All reviews after 2010 are mis-labled or from business tenants. The Rodeway Inn is the only hotel available for reservations in White's City, NM.
